Chip 48 version 2.25 - the version of Chip48 from which Superchip was originally spawned.
This email contains the ASC format for the Chip48 binary for the calculator.

I transmitted this to an HP48 and used the ASC-> program to generate the c48 binary included in this repo.

Recovered from https://groups.google.com/forum/#!searchin/comp.sys.handhelds/2.25/comp.sys.handhelds/z8KoBcbCExQ/q4VsdUu-1ssJ:

Andreas Gustafsson

9/18/90

Here is CHIP48 version 2.25.  It is mostly the same as version 2.20,
except that it is supposed to fix the dreaded "display offset bug".
There is one other small difference: the 2.25 Code object is no longer
self-modifying, so you can put this in ROM if you like :-).  However,
that also means that it will no longer remember the previous state of
the sound on/off flag like 2.20 did.  

The CHIP48 version 2.20 release posting (which includes the
documentation and the BRIX game) is available by anonymous FTP from
vega.hut.fi, directory /pub/misc/hp48sx/asap.  This article and the
source for version 2.20 are also there.

The source and uuencoded binary for version 2.25 will also be made
available for FTP and maybe posted to c.s.h.  Unfortunately they will
be delayed by a week or two because one of the two 40 MB hard disks in
my home machine just broke down, so the machine won't boot although
the source is still safe on the other disk (anybody want to sell or
donate a hard disk? :-()

Decode this using Bill Wickes' ASC-> program and save it as CHIP.  The
checksum should be #9D0Eh and the length as calculated using
"blue-arrow CHIP BYTES" should be 1738 bytes (slightly shorter that
version 2.20).

%%HP: T(1)A(D)F(.);
"CCD20F8D008FFBA818FB976034EC607134152080863F08084315006A9184A345
C1008FD7B5013681AF0C134AF2154716F154716F370000100415C781AF143417
000C213434B550780821837BC13415507808218079B184A34000208FD7B50136
81AF0AAF0AF1AF2AF381AF123400400C213414713514334C2A208A6A11741438
18F843400C108B2606B311747D718F2D760174E78FB976081AF1A13481B43409
B00C2135808210515F0F217015C1161CC96CBE808FD281AF083200281AF0B81A
F1434C2000C2134D21447E53D232831134146DA1468A68F8082408F000EF281A
F017DE05A180874B98F2D760142164808C808F8F75D0081AF1BDA818F0181AF0
377C1135D217015701C0C6C681B4CA3483B00C2134D215E381B4CA81B5818F2B
0681B2460697F11B1088F735608FB97606F6F135147818F2F818F23144818F2F
818F2F818F21164A6C96C2E018A86115F015C0160170CC6AEF01715114E96AB2
161156090AF116015E2801BBE8082200C0E3215C2D232831134146DA1468A68F
8082408F000EF281AF118A6606F70D23108EA3408F000EF681AF0175C014E96A
80A6E14C16114E96A80A6E14C70C0320108018F06110DAD280115E31583FC0EF
68087400808700080873703010374701560FE8082010EF2154062EFD22215702
017114F1C101C681AF12C201D21570C681AF14C213401D23006BEFD230F62EFD
2310168DFD231116ECFD2312164CFD231416ABF7DAFD214E061727F9FD014A07
1C2011727C8F1C2D215E1067D7FD015A107DE01F6F680821100E62067A7F0714
C03C681B4CA34BA800C2134D215E08018F06110DAD280116015E00EF20113613
406762F81AF187BFE13507DA0179DEDAD2310E8A2D031EE8A2640281AF143417
000CA3104D5130146134AF2154716F154716F14C818F04A6D96D7D0381AF1434
C2000C21341428A800818F83140818F24C2134D215E381AF0B037F3E81AF0B03
